intro: Chamaegeron asterellus, commonly known as the rock aster, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It features small, clustered blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy, gray-green leaves that are adapted to withstand cold and harsh environmental conditions. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in tundra and mountainous areas. Chamaegeron asterellus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects and pollinators.
